introduction: The following passage is adapted from The Wright Brothers by David McCullough (2015).
text: McCullough describes how the Wright brothers revolutionized transportation through their groundbreaking experiments in aviation. Their achievement ______ the foundation for the global aviation industry, connecting distant parts of the world and reshaping commerce, travel, and communication.
question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English? Pay close attention to verb tense consistency, subject-verb agreement, and how the verb fits the historical and technological context of the passage.
explanation: Choice B is the best answer. The present perfect has laid connects the Wright brothers’ achievements to their lasting influence on modern aviation, emphasizing their ongoing relevance. Choice A is incorrect because laying does not form a complete verb, leaving the sentence incomplete. Choice C is incorrect because lays incorrectly implies the action is occurring now, disrupting the historical focus. Choice D is incorrect because laid confines the action to the past, missing its continued significance in the present.
